intro: Selago rigida, commonly known as rigid selago, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Selago rigida is often found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland regions. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in well-drained environments.
